data.title: Welcome to Carroll County Water Authority
data.text:
IMPORTANT NEWS!

2023 Water and Sewer Rate Adjustment

CCWA's water and sewer rate increase became effective on the bills received after December 1, 2023. That billing cycle is reflective of water and sewer consumption for the service period from late October through late November. The service period dates will vary depending on your geographical area; the specific service period dates can be found on your bill.

Please refer to the FAQ document for additional details.

2024 FISHING PERMITS

BIG INDIAN CREEK MITIGATION SITE PROJECT

CCWA is beginning work on the Big Indian Creek Mitigation Site Project ("BICMS") which is associated with the Indian Creek Reservoir Project. The BICMS Project is located in the Bowdon area and more information is available on our Water Supply Projects page. Click below for more information.

2024 CONSUMER CONFIDENCE REPORT

The 2024 Consumer Confidence Report for the Carroll County Water Authority available here. CCWA takes pride in distributing quality water safely and reliably to you and your family.

VIEW MORE

BACKFLOW PREVENTION

CCWA maintains a Cross Connection Control (or Backflow Prevention) Program to protect the public potable water distribution system from sources of pollution (low hazards) or contamination (high hazards) flowing back into the water system.

2023 Platinum Award - Snake Creek Water Treatment Plant

Carroll County Water Authority received the 2023 Platinum Award for 100 percent Safe Drinking Water Act compliance for the 2023 calendar year.
